etymologies: mid 19th century (in an earlier sense). From proportional + -ism

definitions: An arrangement or system in which the components or constituent parts of something are dealt with in accordance with their relative proportions; proportionate treatment.
Proportional representation; the adoption or advocacy of a system of proportional representation.
Chiefly in Catholic theology: an ethical system that takes into consideration the context or consequences of an action when judging its morality.
